description: Answer questions with written explanations of phenomena related to mechanical behaviour of metals based on dislocation theory. Includes peer feedback and revision process (~500 words).
2-hour test covering Weeks 1-5 content with calculations, short answers, and problem-solving. Includes three 2% practice quizzes in Weeks 2/4/5.
Numerically-based problems interpreting research data and using theoretical models to predict alloy behaviour, focusing on strengthening mechanisms and microstructural effects.
2-hour exam during finals period covering Weeks 5-10 content. Includes short answer questions, calculations, and analysis of experimental data to predict material behaviour.
